title: Wages Shoot Up in Travel, Food and Other In-Demand Industries
sub_head: November jobs report also offers early signals that  wage growth may be easing
body:
U.S. wages continue to rise at a brisk pace in November, particularly in sectors with the most acute labor shortages, Fridayâ€™s jobs report showed.
Average hourly earnings were 4.8% higher in November compared with a year ago for all private industries, the Labor Department said in its November employment report that also showed payrolls increasing by 210,000 and the unemployment rate dropping to 4.2%.
